parts: Who is responsible for paying for the removal of panels should the roof require repairs

L88: EXHIBITS AND SCHEDULES:
L89: Exhibit A	Description of the Property
L90: Exhibit B	Descriptions of the Site and Building
L91: Exhibit C	Descriptions of Easements

L98: SOLAR SITE LEASE AGREEMENT
L99: This SOLAR SITE LEASE AGREEMENT (this “Lease”) is made and entered into as of [_____________] (the “Effective Date”) by and between [____________] a [_______________] (“Lessor”) and [____________] a [_______________] (“Lessee”).  Each of Lessor and Lessee shall be referred to herein as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”
L100: RECITALS
L101: WHEREAS Lessor holds the fee title interest in the parcel of real property described on Exhibit A (the “Property”) and all improvements thereon including the facility or building described on Exhibit B (the “Building”); 
L102: WHEREAS Lessee desires to lease from Lessor the portion of the roof of the Building described on Exhibit B and such other portions of the Property as may be described on Exhibit B (collectively the “Site”) for the purposes of developing constructing interconnecting commissioning owning operating and maintaining a solar photovoltaic generating system; and
L103: WHEREAS this Lease sets forth the terms and conditions pursuant to which Lessor will lease the Site to Lessee and grant the Easements to Lessee for the Permitted Use including generating transmitting and selling energy capacity and Environmental Attributes to one or more third parties.
L104: AGREEMENT
L105: NOW THEREFORE in consideration of the promises and the mutual covenants herein contained and for other good and valuable consideration the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged the Parties intending to be legally bound hereby agree as follows:
L106: DEFINITIONS; RULES OF INTERPRETATION
L107: Definitions.  As used in this Lease the following terms have the meanings specified below.
L108: “Access Easement” has the meaning established in Section 2.2.
L109: “Affiliate” means a person that directly or indirectly through one or more intermediaries controls is controlled by or is under common control with another person.
L110: “Applicable Law” means (a) any statute law rule regulation code ordinance judgment decree writ order concession grant franchise license agreement directive guidance policy requirement or other governmental restriction of or any binding interpretation or administration of any of the foregoing by any Governmental Authority having jurisdiction over the relevant item whether now or hereafter in effect or (b) any requirements or conditions on or with respect to the issuance maintenance or renewal of any Permit whether now or hereafter in effect.
L111: “Building” means the structure located on the Property that includes the Site as described in Exhibit B. 
L112: “Business Day” means any day other than Saturday Sunday or a day on which the Federal Reserve Bank [or commercial banks in the City/Town of _______] are authorized or required to be closed.
L113: “Casualty Event” has the meaning established in Section 10.1.
L114: “Change in Law” means (a) the enactment adoption promulgation supplement modification or repeal after the Effective Date of any Applicable Law (b) the imposition of any material conditions on the issuance or renewal of any Permit after the Effective Date or (c) a change in any tariff or other requirements binding on the Solar Facility by an electric utility or market operator that in any such case establishes requirements affecting Lessee’s construction ownership operation (including the production and sale of electricity and other projects attributable to the Solar Facility) maintenance or repair of the Solar Facility or on the performance of Lessee’s obligations under this Lease and that has a material adverse effect on the cost or benefit to Lessee of the Solar Facility.
L115: “Claims” has the meaning established in Section 15.1.
L116: “Commercial Operation Date” means the date set forth in a notice from Lessee to Lessor that construction of the Solar Facility is complete Lessee has received all of the approvals required in order to commence regular commercial operation of the Solar Facility and the Solar Facility has commenced regular commercial operation.
L117: “Construction Easement” has the meaning established in Section 2.2.
L118: “Construction Period” means the period commencing on the Effective Date and expiring on the day following the Commercial Operation Date.
L119: “Easement” means any of the Construction Easement the Interconnection Easement the Access Easement and the Solar Easement as provided in in Section 2.2[ and as further described in Exhibit C].
L120: “Effective Date” means the date specified in the first paragraph of this Lease.
L121: “Environmental Attributes” means any and all mandatory and voluntary federal state or local renewable energy or emissions credits rebates subsidy incentive payment or any other green tag renewable energy emissions reduction depreciation tax credits other tax benefits or other benefit related to the environmental characteristics of the Solar Facility whether related to any renewable portfolio standard or other renewable energy purchase requirement incentive program voluntary compliance program or otherwise whether existing as of the Effective Date or enacted thereafter.
L122: “Environmental Law” means any applicable federal state municipal or local law statute rule regulation ordinance code judgment decree or decision implementing any of the foregoing by any Governmental Authority relating to (a) the protection of the air water land or natural resources or (b) the generation use handling treatment storage disposal and transportation of Hazardous Material in each case applicable to the Property.
L123: “Expected Output” means the amount of electricity (in kWh) expected to be produced by the Solar Facility for a given calendar month or other period (as applicable) during the Operations Period.
L124: “Extension Period” means each extension of the Term described as such on Schedule 2.
L125: “Financing Party” means any Person (and the agents thereof) providing financing of any kind to Lessee in connection with the Solar Facility including debt or equity.
L126: “Good Solar Industry Practices” mean those practices methods equipment specifications and standards of safety and performance as to which there may be more than one and as the same may change from time to time as are commonly applied in connection with solar photovoltaic energy systems of a type and size similar to the Solar Facility and in the same geographic region as the Property that in the exercise of reasonable judgment in light of the facts known at the time of determination would be expected to result in an outcome consistent with Applicable Law reliability safety economy and efficiency.
L127: “Governmental Authority” means any federal state county or  municipal government any political subdivision thereof or any other legislative administrative judicial public or statutory instrumentality authority body agency bureau or entity in each case having jurisdiction over the applicable subject matter or over this Lease the Solar Facility Lessor Lessee the Site or the Property.
L128: “Hazardous Materials” means any chemical waste or other substance (a) that now or hereafter becomes defined as or included in the definition of “hazardous substances” “hazardous wastes” “hazardous materials” “extremely hazardous wastes” “restricted hazardous wastes” “toxic substances” “toxic pollutants” “pollution” “pollutants” “regulated substances” or words of similar import under any Environmental Laws (b) that is declared to be hazardous toxic or polluting by any Governmental Authority (c) exposure to which is now or hereafter prohibited limited or regulated by any Governmental Authority (d) the storage use handling disposal or release of which is restricted or regulated by any Governmental Authority or (e) for which remediation or cleanup is required by any Governmental Authority.
L129: “Indemnifying Party” means the Party responsibility for indemnification of a Claim pursuant to Section 15. 
L130: “Indemnitee” means either a Lessee Indemnitee or Lessor Indemnitee as applicable.
L131:  “Insolation” has the meaning established in the Section 5.2(e).
L132: “Interconnection Agreement” means an agreement between the [Lessee] and the Utility pursuant to which the Solar Facility may be interconnected to the Utility’s electric distribution system.
L133: “Interconnection Easement” has the meaning established in Section 2.2(a).
L134: “Lease” means this Solar Site Lease Agreement by and between Lessor and Lessee including all exhibits schedules and attachments hereto as it may be amended or modified from time to time.
L135: “Lessee” means [__________] or its successors and assigns from time to time.
L136: “Lessor” means [___________] and its successors and assigns from time to time.
L137: “Lessor Easements” has the meaning established in Section 2.2(b).
L138: “Lessor Indemnitees” has the meaning established in Section 15.2.
L139: “Lessor Sub-easement” as the meaning established in Section 2.2(b).
L140: “Lessor’s Engineer” means an independent engineer engaged by Lessor that has substantial experience in the engineering construction and operation of solar generating facilities.
L141: “Mortgage” has the meaning established in Section 13.3(a).
L142: “Mortgagee” has the meaning established in Section 13.3(a).
L143:  “Operations Period” means the period beginning on the expiration of the Construction Period and continuing for the period set forth on Schedule 1 as extended hereunder including as extended by any Extension Period.
L144: “Permit” means permits approvals clearances and determinations issued by a Governmental Authority and which for this purpose includes the issuance of “permission to operate” by the Utility or similar approval for the Solar Facility to operate to generate electricity and deliver electricity to the Lessor’s electric system or the utility’s electric grid.
L145: “Permitted Use” has the meaning established in Section 4.1.
L146: “Person” means a natural person corporation partnership limited liability company business entity trust organization association or any Governmental Authority.
L147: “Property” means the parcel of real property located at the address set forth on Exhibit A together with all improvements located thereon and rights benefits and easements appurtenant thereto as further described on Exhibit A.
L148: “Removal License” has the meaning established in Section 2.3.
L149: “Rent” means the rent payable to Lessor in accordance with Section 2.5 and Schedule 2.
L150: “Roof Warranty” means if any each warranty of condition and performance of the portion of the Building roof that includes any portion of the Site issued by Lessor’s contractor or any warranty provider and in effect as of the Effective Date attached hereto as Exhibit E.
L151: “Solar Easement” has the meaning established in Section 2.2(a).
L152: “Site” means portion of the Building and the Property leased to Lessee hereunder and on which the Solar Facility will be located as further described on Exhibit B.
L153: “Site Plan” means the general layout of the Solar Facility at the Site attached to Exhibit B.
L154: “Solar Easement” has the meaning established in Exhibit C.
L155: “Solar Facility” means the photovoltaic solar power generation facility interconnection facilities and related equipment and installations including [battery energy storage equipment and enclosures] to be developed constructed interconnected commissioned owned operated and maintained by Lessee at the Site in accordance with this Lease as further described in Exhibit D.
L156: “Solar Facility Design” means the Solar Facility drawings prepared for purposes of obtaining a building and electrical Permits including structural drawings [stamped by a professional engineer].  
L157: “Taking” has the meaning established in Section 11.1.
L158: “Tax Incentives” means any and all (a) depreciation benefits (b) investment tax credits (c) production tax credits (d) tax exemptions or abatements and (e) similar tax credits or grants under federal state or local law relating to the construction ownership existence or production of energy from the Solar Facility.
L159: “Term” has the meaning established in Section 3.1.
L160: “Utility” means the electric distribution company that provides electric services to the Property.
L161: Interpretation.  In this Lease unless the context requires otherwise the singular includes the plural and the plural the singular; references to statutes or regulations are to be construed as including all statutory or regulatory provisions consolidating amending replacing succeeding or supplementing the statute or regulation referred to; the words “including” “includes” and “include” shall be deemed to be followed by the words “without limitation” or “but not limited to” or words of similar import; the word “or” shall be interpreted to mean “and/or” rather than “either/or”; references to Sections (or subdivisions of Sections) Exhibits or Schedules are to those of this Lease unless otherwise indicated and are incorporated herein; references to agreements and other contractual instruments shall be deemed to include all exhibits schedules and appendices attached thereto and all subsequent amendments and other modifications to such agreements or instruments and references to Persons include their respective successors and assigns.
L162: LEASE AND EASEMENTS; RENT
L163: Grant of Leasehold Interest.  Effective as of the Effective Date and subject to the terms hereof Lessor hereby grants demises and leases the Site to Lessee and Lessee hereby leases the Site from Lessor for the Permitted Use and for such other activities necessary and incidental to the Permitted Use TO HAVE AND TO HOLD the Site together with all rights privileges easements and appurtenances thereunto belonging and attaching.
L164: Easements and Related Rights.
L165: Easements.  Effective as of the Effective Date and subject to the terms hereof Lessor hereby irrevocably grants and conveys to Lessee for the Term each of the Easements.
L166: Construction Easement.  A temporary easement on over and across those areas of the Property (including the Building) [shown in Exhibit C-1] for access staging storage and laydown in connection with the construction installation interconnection maintenance repair  and removal of the Solar Facility including tools materials and equipment and for parking construction crew vehicles and temporary construction trailers and facilities reasonably necessary in connection with such activities (the “Construction Easement”).  Lessee shall have the right to grant a sub-easement in the Construction Easement to the Utility if the Utility will be installing any equipment on the Property or the Interconnection Easement as required in order to interconnect the Solar Facility to the electricity grid.
L167: Interconnection Easement.  A non-exclusive easement on over through or under certain portions of the Property [(including the Building)] [shown in Exhibit C-2] (“Interconnection Easement Area”) to install interconnect use maintain repair and operate cables poles network connections data acquisition systems telecommunications systems electrical wiring wire management systems electric meters power distribution boxes connecting hardware and other equipment and materials used by Lessee for communications equipment or to interconnect the Solar Facility with the electric power grid (the “Interconnection Easement”).  Lessee shall have the right to grant a sub-easement in the Interconnection Easement to the Utility if necessary for the Utility to install and maintain its equipment thereon as required to interconnect the Solar Facility with the electricity grid. 
L168: Access Easement.  A non-exclusive easement and right-of-way on over and across those areas of the Property and the Building [shown in Exhibit C-3] for vehicular and pedestrian ingress egress and access to and from the Site and the Easements by means of (A) the now existing or hereafter constructed roads lanes and rights-of-way on the Property and (B) access and egress points in and to the Building (the “Access Easement”).   
L169: Solar Easement.  An exclusive easement and right on and over the Property to evaluate develop capture use and convert all solar energy resources found on about over across and at the Site including the sole and exclusive right to the free and unobstructed Insolation and flow of solar energy resources on about over and across the Property to the Site (the “Solar Easement”). 
L170: Lessor Easements.  To the extent that Lessor holds or has the right to use any access utility transmission water or other easements rights of way over lands in the general vicinity of the Property  (the “Lessor Easements”) and such Lessor Easements could be used by Lessee consistent with the Permitted Use then Lessee shall be entitled to use such Lessor Easements if and to the extent that such use is within the scope of the Lessor Easements and provided that such use does not interfere with Lessor’s use of the Lessor’s Easements.  At the request of Lessee at any time during the Term Lessor shall grant to the Lessee in writing in recordable form and containing such terms and provisions as reasonably may be requested by Lessee for no additional consideration one or more sub-easements of Lessor Easements (each a “Lessor Sub-easement”).  The term of each Lessor Sub-easement shall run concurrently with the Term (or for such shorter period as the term of the applicable Lessor Easement) and shall terminate upon the expiration or termination of the Term or the term of the Lessor Easement as applicable.
L171: Contractors etc.  Lessor acknowledges that from time to time Lessee’s contractors and their subcontractors and other invitees may access and enter upon the Site the Building and the Easements in order to construct install interconnect operate maintain and repair the Solar Facility and related equipment and provide other services to Lessee or conduct other activities for or on behalf of Lessee in connection with the Solar Facility.  
L172: Removal License.  Lessor hereby grants to Lessee a license to access and enter upon and occupy the Site the Building and the Easements following the expiration of the Term or earlier termination of this Lease for the purpose or removing the Solar Facility in accordance with Section 5.1 (the “Removal License”).  The Removal License shall survive the expiration or termination of this Lease.  
L173: General Terms Relating to the Easements.  As to each Easement and Lessor Sub-Easement granted herein (a) to the extent permitted by Applicable Law it shall be appurtenant to the leasehold (b) it shall run with the land and inure to the benefit of and be binding upon Lessor and Lessee (c) no act or failure to act on the part of the Lessee shall be deemed to constitute an abandonment surrender or termination thereof except upon recordation by Lessee of the applicable instrument effective to release such Easement or Lessor Sub-Easement which Lessee shall promptly record following the termination of the applicable Easement or Lessor Sub-Easement as provided herein (d) nonuse of any such Easement or for any period of time shall not prevent the future use of such Easement for any allowable purpose and (e) Lessor shall not allow any use of the Easements by any other Person that could interfere with or limit Lessee’s use thereof as provided herein.
L174: Rent.  Lessee shall pay to Lessor the annual Rent in the amount set forth in the Schedule 2 payable in quarterly installments.  The first payment of Rent shall be due on the first Business Day of the calendar quarter following the Commercial Operation Date for the portion of the calendar quarter from the Commercial Operation Date to the end of such calendar quarter and each subsequent payment of Rent shall be made on the first day of each calendar quarter of the Term thereafter for the previous calendar quarter.  If the Term expires or is earlier terminated on a day other than the last day of a calendar quarter then Rent payable for such calendar quarter shall be prorated in proportion to the number of days elapsed and remaining in such calendar quarter.  
L175: Modified Descriptions of Site and Easements.  If Lessee obtains a recordable survey of the Building or any of the Easements Lessee will provide a copy of such survey to Lessor and such survey or the legal descriptions included therein shall be deemed to replace the descriptions of the Site or the Easements as applicable in Exhibit B or Exhibit C respectively and the Site and the Easements shall thereafter be as described in Exhibit B or Exhibit C as modified.
L176: Memoranda.  Within ten (10) Business Days following the request of Lessee Lessor shall execute and deliver to Lessee any documents or instruments reasonably requested by Lessee in form for recordation in the land records of the applicable jurisdiction to evidence the interest granted hereunder in the Site and the Easements and any amendments which may include (or replace) the descriptions of the Site and Easements as provided herein.  
L177: TERM AND TERMINATION
L178: Term.  This Lease is effective as of the Effective Date and unless this Lease is terminated pursuant to the terms hereof it shall continue until the expiration of the Operations Period as the Operations Period may be extended by any Extension Period.  The Construction Period and the Operations Period are collectively referred to herein as the “Term”.
L179: Construction Period Activities.  During the Construction Period Lessee may conduct any and all activities necessary and incidental to the construction and installation of the Solar Facility including completing its due diligence investigation of the Site and the Property and other studies related to the Solar Facility and obtaining Permits.  Lessor shall cooperate with Lessee as reasonably requested in connection with such activities including promptly providing information or documentation required to support permitting and other approvals for the Solar Facility.
L180: Early Termination.  Notwithstanding anything in this Lease Lessee may terminate this Lease by giving not less than sixty (60) days notice to Lessor in which event this Lease shall terminate as of the date specified in such notice.  If such termination occurs following the Commercial Operation Date then Lessee shall pay to Lessor the Rent accrued to the date of termination [plus [________]].  Neither party shall have any liability by reason of such termination and shall thereafter have no further rights or obligations under this Lease other than as provided in this Section 3.3 and Section 5.1(d) (if applicable) and any other rights or obligations arising prior to such termination.
L181: PERMITTED USE; DESIGN REVIEW
L182: Permitted Use.  Lessee may use the Site (a) to develop construct interconnect own operate maintain modify repair replace and remove the Solar Facility (b) for all activities necessary and incidental to the production and delivery of electricity capacity Environmental Attributes and any related products and services attributable to the Solar Facility and (c) for such other uses as are reasonably and customarily related to such activities and the exercise of its other rights in respect of the Site provided herein (the “Permitted Use”).  The Permitted Use includes construction and installation of structural elements to physically support equipment or components of the Solar Facility including hardware racking and other elements used to attach the solar modules and other components at or to the Site.  Lessee may implement reasonable security measures to control and monitor access to the Site including posting signs and installing lighting and cameras.  Lessee shall use and occupy the Site and the Easements in compliance in all material respects with Applicable Laws and Permits.
L183: Solar Facility Design; Design Review.  
L184: Lessee will design and engineer the Solar Facility (i) based on inspections of the Building undertaken by Lessee and (ii) in compliance with Applicable Law.  Lessee shall deliver the Solar Facility Design to Lessor’s Engineer for review at least sixty (60) days prior to Lessee’s commencement of construction at the Site which review shall be limited to confirmation that the Solar Facility Design complies with Applicable Law the structural characteristics of the Site and the Roof Warranty and that the Solar Facility would not unreasonably interfere with Lessor’s use of or operations at the Building as currently conducted.  Lessor shall have thirty (30) days from receipt of the Solar Facility Design to review the Solar Facility Design and deliver any comments in writing which comments shall be accompanied by supporting materials.  If Lessor provides comments Lessee shall address such comments to reasonably demonstrate that the Solar Facility will comply with Applicable Law comply with the Roof Warranty and will not unreasonably interfere with Lessor’s operations at the Building as currently conducted and shall submit the revised Solar Facility Design to Lessor and Lessor’s Engineer.  Lessor may review such changes on the same basis and procedure as the review of the previous Solar Facility Design as provided in this Section 4.2.  Lessee may request as a condition of the construction or any modification of the Solar Facility that the provider of the Roof Warranty confirm in writing that the Solar Facility as described in the Solar Facility Design or any modification thereof complies with and will not void or otherwise affect the Roof Warranty and Lessor shall reasonably cooperate with Lessee to obtain such confirmation.   
L185: Lessee will provide Lessor with “as-built” drawings of the Solar Facility within ninety (90) days following the Commercial Operation Date.  
L186: COVENANTS; REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES
L187: Covenants of Lessee.  Lessee covenants to Lessor as set forth in this Section 5.1.
L188: Compliance with Applicable Law and Roof Warranty.  Lessee shall comply in all material respects with all Applicable Laws and the Permits.  The Solar Facility shall be constructed and operated in a manner that does not unreasonably interfere with the ongoing operations at the Building does not penetrate the roof or roof membrane (except as shown in the Solar Facility Design) and does not cause the termination of the Roof Warranty which if requested by Lessee shall be established by the written confirmation of the provider of the Roof Warranty as provided in Section 4.2.
L189: Construction.  Lessee shall or shall cause the Solar Facility to be constructed installed operated and maintained in accordance with Good Solar Industry Practices and in compliance at all times with Lessor’s reasonable health safety and security policies provided to Lessee and that do not unreasonably interfere with the construction installation interconnection operation or maintenance of the Solar Facility.  
L190: Maintenance.  Lessee shall use commercially reasonable efforts to maintain the Site and the Easements (to the extent of Lessee’s use thereof) in an orderly and clean condition.  In addition if the Solar Facility will interconnect to the Building electrical system then Lessee shall be responsible for any modifications or upgrades to the Building electrical system required [as shown in the Solar Facility Design] for such interconnection and shall maintain such upgrades or modifications during the Term.  Lessee will provide Lessor with reasonable notice prior to accessing the Building for the maintenance or repair of the Solar Facility except that in the case of an emergency Lessee will provide such notice as is reasonably practicable in the circumstances.  Lessee will promptly notify Lessor of any condition of the Solar Facility of which it is aware that could reasonably be expected to adversely affect the Building.  Other than in the event of an emergency Lessee will not make any alterations or repairs to the Solar Facility that could reasonably be expected by Lessee to have or cause a material adverse effect on the operation or maintenance of the Building without Lessor’s prior written consent which consent will not be unreasonably withheld conditioned or delayed.
L191: Removal.  Within one hundred eighty (180) days after the expiration of the Term or earlier termination of this Lease as provided herein Lessee at its sole cost and expense shall decommission and remove the Solar Facility installed as provided in Section 2.2(c) from the Site and to the extent applicable the Easements.  Lessee shall remove any remaining debris and equipment from the Site and the Property following the removal.  If Lessee does not remove or commence and continue efforts to remove the Solar Facility within such one hundred eighty (180) day period then the Solar Facility shall be deemed abandoned by Lessee. The Lessor shall give Lessee written notice of abandonment and state that Lessee’s rights under this Lease shall expire and terminate on the date specified in such notice which shall be no earlier than an additional thirty (30) days following such notice and on and following the date specified at Lessor’s sole discretion (i) Lessor shall have the right to assume title to the Solar Facility and Lessee shall thereupon have no further liability in respect thereof or (ii) within a further ninety (90) days Lessor may remove the Solar Facility or other improvements at Lessee’s cost and in a commercially reasonable manner in accordance with Applicable Law.  For the avoidance of doubt and if applicable Lessee shall have no obligation to (w) restore the Site or the Easements to their contours prior to construction of the Solar Facility (x) remove (A) supports anchors penetrations conduits or other similar ancillary equipment if in Lessee’s reasonable determination such removal could cause harm or damage to the Site the Building or the Easements or (B) any below-grade foundations or underground buried or covered conduits and cabling installed by Lessee at the Site (including equipment installed on or in the Building) or at the Easements all of which shall be decommissioned in accordance with Applicable Law and abandoned in place (y) restore any improvements removed or modified in connection with the Permitted Use or (z) replant any vegetation removed in connection with the Permitted Use.
L192: 
L193: Covenants of Lessor.  Lessor covenants to Lessee as set forth in this Section 5.2.
L194: Quiet Enjoyment.  Lessor covenants that Lessee shall at all times during the Term peaceably and quietly have hold and enjoy the Site and the Easements without hindrance or disturbance of any kind by Lessor or any Person claiming by through or under Lessor.  Subject to the terms of this Lease Lessor shall protect and defend the right title and interest of Lessee hereunder from any other rights interests title and claims.  Without limiting the generality of the foregoing Lessee shall have quiet and peaceful possession of the Site and the Easements and the exclusive right of occupancy of the Site.
L195: Repair and Maintenance.  Lessor shall maintain and repair the Property as would a prudent owner including the roof and structure of the Building in a manner sufficient to allow for the safe exercise of the Permitted Use during the Term including normal repairs maintenance and if necessary replacement of the rooftop including the portion of the rooftop within the Site.   Lessor shall not make any alterations to the Building that could reasonably be expected to cause a material adverse effect on the Insolation or on the operation and maintenance of the Solar Facility without Lessee’s prior written consent in its sole discretion.  If Lessor wishes to make any alterations or repairs or maintenance that reasonably could be expected to result in a material adverse effect to the Insolation or to the operation and maintenance of the Solar Facility then Lessor and Lessee shall work in good faith to determine wither such alteration repairs or maintenance could be implemented in a manner that avoids any adverse effect on the Solar Facility; provided that  in all cases and notwithstanding any such advice Lessor shall be responsible for all damage to the Solar Facility or reduction in the output of the Solar Facility based on historic performance or if such event occurs during the first two years of the Operations Period on the Expected Output resulting from such alterations or repairs.  To the extent that temporary disconnection or removal of the Solar Facility is necessary for Lessor to perform such alterations or repairs the Lessor shall provide not less than sixty (60) days’ notice to Lessee and such work and any reinstallation of the Solar Facility after completion of Lessor’s alterations and repairs shall be done by Lessee or its contractors the reasonable costs of which shall be paid by Lessor.  In addition if as a result of such temporary disconnection or removal of the Solar Facility the Solar Facility is totally or partially disconnected for more than forty-eight (48) daylight hours during the Term then for any period exceeding such hours the Solar Facility is totally or partially disconnected as contemplated in this Section 5.2(b) Lessor shall pay Lessee at the rates then in effect for any electricity capacity or other electric attributes of the Solar Facility and the Environmental Attributes that otherwise could have been produced by the Solar Facility during the time that the Solar Facility is not operating.  The amount of lost revenue shall be determined based on the historic performance of the Solar Facility or if such event occurs during the first two years of the Operations Period on the Expected Output.  All of Lessor’s alterations and repairs shall be done in a good and workmanlike manner and in compliance with all Applicable Laws and shall not have a material adverse effect on the interconnection or operation of the Solar Facility (once the Solar Facility has been reinstalled to the extent removed as provided in this Section 5.2(b)).
L196: Utilities.  Lessor shall make available to Lessee throughout the Term and Lessee may use in connection with the Permitted Use all electricity water internet service and trash collection and other utility services located at the Site.  
L197: Cooperation; Access.  
L198: Lessor shall (A) provide Lessee and its subcontractors consultants agents and representatives with reasonable access to the Property for the purpose of designing the Solar Facility including conducting related inspections and studies (including structural inspections of the Building’s roof) and accessing relevant documents materials and records of Lessor related to the Property or the Building (B) comply with Lessee’s reasonable requests for information about the Building (including a copy of the roof warranty as then in effect) and access to the Building for purposes of designing and installing the Solar Facility and (C) cooperate at Lessee’s sole cost and expense with Lessee’s reasonable requests to assist Lessee in obtaining any necessary agreements and Permits including (1) any zoning land use environmental building and other Permits required to construct install interconnect operate and maintain the Solar Facility and (2) any agreements and approvals from the Utility necessary in order to interconnect the Solar Facility to the Building’s electrical system or the Utility’s electric distribution system.
L199: Lessor will not and will not permit other Persons to conduct activities on in or about the Property that Lessee determines in its reasonable discretion may damage impair or otherwise adversely affect the Solar Facility or that could cause injury to persons.
L200: Lessor acknowledges that the free and unobstructed flow of sunlight (“Insolation”) to the Solar Facility is essential to the value to Lessee of the leasehold granted hereunder and is a material inducement to Lessee in entering into this Lease.  Without limitation of the Solar Easement Lessor shall not interfere nor permit any interference with Insolation at the Site and without limitation Lessor shall not construct or permit to be constructed any structure or any modification to any structure (including the Building) that could adversely affect Insolation nor shall Lessor permit the growth of foliage that could adversely affect Insolation or emit or permit the emission of suspended particulate matter smoke or steam or other airborne impediments to Insolation whether on the Property or any adjacent or nearby property owned or controlled by Lessor or any Affiliate of Lessor.  Lessor shall notify Lessee if Lessor becomes aware of any potential development or other activity on adjacent or nearby properties that could diminish the Insolation to the Site and Lessor shall cooperate with Lessee to preserve current levels of Insolation at the Site.  The Parties acknowledge that (A) Lessee would be irreparably harmed by a breach of this Section 5.2(d)(vii) (B) an award of monetary damages would be inadequate to remedy such a breach and (C) Lessee shall be entitled to seek equitable relief including specific performance to compel compliance with the provisions of this Section 5.2(d)(vii).  In addition Lessor hereby grants to Lessee the right without notice to or consent of Lessor to remove trim prune top or otherwise control the growth of any tree shrub plant or other vegetation on the Property to the extent it obstructs or limits Insolation to the Site at Lessor’s cost including by set off from amounts payable by Lessee to Lessor.
L201: Representations of Lessee.  As of the Effective Date Lessee represents and warrants as follows:
L202: The execution and delivery by Lessee of and the performance of its obligations under this Lease have been duly authorized by all necessary action do not and will not require any further consent or approval of any other person and do not contravene any provision of or constitute a default under any indenture mortgage or other material agreement binding on Lessee or any valid order of any court or regulatory agency or Governmental Authority to which Lessee is subject.  
L203: This Lease constitutes a legal and valid obligation of Lessee enforceable against Lessee except as may be limited by bankruptcy reorganization insolvency bank moratorium or laws relating to or affecting creditors’ rights generally and general principles of equity whether such enforceability is considered in a proceeding in equity or at law and as may be otherwise provided for in this Lease.
L204: Representations of Lessor.  As of the Effective Date Lessor represents and warrants as follows:
L205: The execution and delivery by Lessor of and the performance of its obligations under this Lease have been duly authorized by all necessary action do not and will not require any further consent or approval of any other person and do not violate any provision of or constitute a default under any indenture mortgage lease or other material agreement binding on Lessor or any valid order of any court or regulatory agency or Governmental Authority to which Lessor is subject.  
L206: This Lease constitutes a legal and valid obligation of Lessor enforceable against Lessor except as may be limited by bankruptcy reorganization insolvency bank moratorium or laws relating to or affecting creditors’ rights generally and general principles of equity whether such enforceability is considered in a proceeding in equity or at law and as may be otherwise provided for in this Lease.  
L207: Lessor is not bankrupt or insolvent and Lessor has no reasonable basis to believe that it will become bankrupt or insolvent during the Term.
L208: Lessor has good and marketable fee simple title to the Property and the Building.  Lessor represents that there are no covenants restrictions rights of way leases licenses easements or other encumbrances affecting the Property or the Building that could prevent limit or adversely affect Lessee’s use of the Site for the Permitted Use and its exercise of its other rights hereunder.  [There are no Mortgages liens or other encumbrances affecting the Site the Easements or the Building.]
L209: Lessor has paid all taxes assessed on the Property the Building and any fixtures or improvements thereon or thereat that are due and payable.  No rollback or similar payments will be payable in connection with the Permitted Use.
L210: Attached hereto as Exhibit E is a true complete and correct copy of the Roof Warranty.
L211: TITLE; LIENS
L212: Title to the Solar Facility.  The Solar Facility and all components equipment and materials thereof and ancillary thereto and all alterations additions and improvements thereto is are and shall remain the personal property of Lessee (“Lessee Property”).  No Lessee Property shall be deemed a fixture to the Building or the property of Lessor nor shall Lessor nor anyone claiming an interest in the Building (including any present or future Mortgagee) have any rights in or to the Lessee Property at any time.  Lessor shall have no ownership or other interest in the Lessee Property.  Lessor hereby waives any statutory or common law lien that it might otherwise have in or to Lessee Property or any portion thereof regardless of the means or manner in which the Solar Facility is installed at the Site.
L213: Incentives.  As between Lessor and Lessee Lessee shall own all Environmental Attributes and be entitled to the benefit of all Tax Incentives in connection with the Solar Facility.  
L214: Liens.
L215: Liens Caused by Lessor.  Lessor shall not cause create incur assume suffer to exist or permit any lien or encumbrance (including any lender’s mechanic’s laborer’s or materialman’s lien) affecting the Solar Facility or the Site.  Lessor will promptly give Lessee written notice of such lien and will promptly take such action as is necessary or appropriate to have the lien discharged and removed of record.  Lessor shall be solely responsible for any and all costs and expenses incurred in discharging and releasing such lien.
L216: Liens Caused by Lessee.  Lessee shall not cause create incur assume or suffer to exist any lien or encumbrance (including any lender’s mechanics’ labor or materialman’s lien) affecting the Building (other than the Lessee Property or Lessee’s interest in this Lease and the rights in the Site granted hereunder).  Lessee will promptly give Lessor written notice of any such lien and will promptly take such action as is necessary or appropriate to have the lien discharged and removed of record.  Lessee shall be solely responsible for any and all costs and expenses incurred in discharging and releasing such lien.
L217: Removal of Liens.  If any lender’s mechanic’s laborer’s or materialman’s lien shall at any time be filed against the Building the Site or the Lessee Property in breach of Section 6.3(a) or Section 6.3(b) the Party responsible for the discharge thereof (the “Discharging Party”) shall cause within sixty (60) days after receiving notice of the filing thereof such lien to be discharged of record by payment deposit bond insurance order of court of competent jurisdiction or otherwise.  If the Discharging Party fails to cause such lien to be discharged within such period then in addition to any other right or remedy in respect thereof the other Party may but shall not be obligated to discharge the same either by paying the amount claimed to be due or by procuring the discharge of such lien by deposit or by bonding.  The costs and expenses reasonably incurred by such Party in connection with such actions shall be paid by the Discharging Party within sixty (60) days of such Party’s delivery to the Discharging Party of an invoice therefor together with supporting documentation of such costs and expenses and without limitation of such Party’s remedies may be set off from any amounts owing to the Discharging Party hereunder.
L218: 
L219: HAZARDOUS MATERIALS
L220: 
L221: Hazardous Materials.  
L222: In granting this Lease Lessor does not intend that Lessee becomes liable for any past present or future contamination or pollution or breach of any applicable Law pertaining to the existence use storage or disposal of Hazardous Materials if any located on or related to the Building or the Property including the Site and land beneath.  Accordingly Lessor assumes full liability for any contamination or pollution or violation of Environmental Law applicable to the existence use storage or disposal of Hazardous Materials on in under or through the Building or the Property other than in connection with Hazardous Materials brought to the Building or the Property by or on behalf of Lessee or its contractors if any.
L223: Lessee and its contractors shall bring Hazardous Materials to the Property only as reasonably necessary in connection with and to the extent necessary for the Permitted Use.  Lessee shall and shall require its contractors to transport use and dispose of Hazardous Materials brought to the Property if any in accordance with all applicable Environmental Laws.  
L224: If Lessee becomes aware of any Hazardous Materials existing on the Property Lessee shall promptly notify Lessor and if the presence of such Hazardous Materials results in or could reasonably be expected to have any adverse effect on the Permitted Use or in any liability to Lessee Lessee may in its sole discretion request that Lessor remediate the affected portion of the Property within a reasonable period taking into account the scope of the remediation in accordance with Environmental Laws and the requirements of any applicable Governmental Authority.  Lessee may suspend construction or operation of the Solar Facility and its performance hereunder until such time as Lessor has fully remediated the Property.  Rent shall be abated for the period of such suspension and at Lessee’s request the Operations Period if then in effect shall be extended for a period equal to the duration of the suspension.    Nothing in this Section 7.3 limits either Party’s indemnity obligations in Section 15.
L225: Each Party shall promptly notify the other Party if it becomes aware of any Hazardous Material on or about the Solar Facility generally or any deposit spill or release of any Hazardous Material.
L226: TAXES
L227: Tax Obligations of Lessee.  Lessee shall pay on or prior to the due date therefor all personal property taxes and assessments levied against the Solar Facility.  Lessee shall be entitled to seek and obtain any tax exemption or tax abatement applicable to the Solar Facility or the Site including entering into an agreement for payments in lieu of taxes.  At Lessee’s request Lessor shall cooperate with and use commercially reasonable efforts to assist Lessee (at no cost to Lessor) in obtaining tax exemptions or tax abatements applicable to the Solar Facility and if applicable the Site.
L228: Tax Obligations of Lessor.  If applicable Lessor shall pay when due all real property taxes and assessments levied against the Building or the Property and all personal property taxes and assessments levied against any personal property and improvements owned or operated by Lessor and located on the Building or Property.  If Lessor fails to pay any such taxes or assessments when due and without limitation of Lessee’s rights hereunder Lessee may at its option pay those taxes and assessments and any accrued interest and penalties and set off such amounts paid from any amounts due to Lessor under this Lease.
L229: LESSOR’S RIGHT OF ENTRY
L230: Access to Site and Easements. 
L231: Lessor’s personnel shall have the right to enter the Site at its own risk with not less than two Business Days’ prior notice to Lessee and without limitation of Section 5.2(b) only as may be necessary in connection with the maintenance or repair of the Site provided that such access does not interfere with or affect the operation of the Solar Facility and provided that except in cases of emergency as provided in Section 9.1(b) Lessor’s personnel shall be accompanied by a representative of Lessee while present on the Site.  
L232: Notwithstanding Section 9.1(a) in the event there arises any condition at the Site that creates a reasonable likelihood of imminent serious injury to persons or damage to property and Lessor is unable to timely contact Lessee or Lessee is unable to timely mitigate the potential impacts Lessor and its authorized representatives may enter on the Site to take such immediate action as it reasonably determines is necessary under the circumstances to avoid such injury or damage and in doing so shall comply with all guidance that has been provided by Lessee.  Lessor shall promptly notify Lessee of such condition and the actions taken.  Lessor shall have no liability to Lessee in such event for its reasonable actions taken to mitigate the potential for immediate impacts of such condition.  
L233: No Lessee Liability.  While present on the portions of the Site or the Easements where the Solar Facility or related equipment is located Lessor’s personnel and invitees shall not touch interfere with or otherwise in any way affect the Solar Facility or any related equipment and shall comply with all safety requirements posted or otherwise communicated to such Persons.  To the fullest extent allowed by Applicable Law Lessor waives for itself and on behalf of its personnel and invitees any liability of Lessee and its contractors and other vendors for any injury to such Persons or damage to property in connection with such Person’s access to or presence on the Site or the Easements.  Except as provided in Section 9.1(b) Lessor shall be liable for any damage to the Site the Building or the Solar Facility occurring in connection with such access by its personnel or invitees. 
L234: CASUALTY
L235: Casualty Affecting the Solar Facility.  In the event that the Solar Facility is materially damaged or destroyed in whole or part such that the Solar Facility is unable to safely and economically operate at its design capacity at the Site Lessee may determine whether and to what extent to repair or restore the Solar Facility and shall notify Lessor of such determination within ninety (90) days following the relevant event.  If Lessee determines not to repair or restore the Solar Facility and to cease operation of the Solar Facility then Lessee’s notice to Lessor may include its election to terminate the Lease as of the date specified in such notice.  Following such termination Lessee shall remove the Solar Facility as provided in Section 5.1(d).  If Lessee elects to repair the Solar Facility then at Lessee’s request (a) the Operations Period if then in effect shall be extended as requested by Lessee up to a period equivalent to the period during which the Solar Facility was unable to fully operate and (b) Lessee shall commence the restoration of the Solar Facility within [ninety (90)] days after Lessee’s receipt of (i) the insurance proceeds with respect to such casualty (if insurance proceeds are available for the applicable event) and (ii) all Permits required to restore the Solar Facility and return the Solar Facility to regular commercial operation. 
L236: Casualty Affecting the Site.  If all or substantially all of the Building is damaged by fire or other casualty such that the Solar Facility is damaged or is otherwise  unable to safely and economically operate at its design capacity at the Site (regardless whether or not the Solar Facility was damaged in connection with the same event) then Lessor shall notify Lessee within ninety (90) days following the relevant event whether it will repair or restore the Building such that the Solar Facility is able to safely operate at its design capacity.  If Lessor determines not to repair or restore the Building then Lessor’s notice to Lessee may include its election to terminate this Lease as of the date specified in such notice.  If this Lease is not terminated as provided in the preceding sentence then Lessor shall restore the Building to substantially its former condition prior to such damage and this Lease shall remain in full force and effect; provided that (a) if it is determined or reasonably likely that the restoration of the Building will not be completed within [_____] then Lessee shall have the right to terminate this Lease by notice to Lessor or (b) Rent shall be proportionally abated to the extent the Solar Facility is unable to generate or deliver electricity from the date of occurrence of the damage to the date that either this Lease is terminated or the Solar Facility is restored on the Site and is in regular commercial operation. If Lessor elects to repair the Building then (a) the Operations Period if then in effect shall be extended as requested by Lessee up to a period equivalent to the period during which the Solar Facility is unable to fully operate and (b) Lessor shall commence the restoration of the facility within [ninety (90)] days after Lessor’s receipt of (i) the insurance proceeds with respect to such casualty (if insurance proceeds are available for the applicable event) and (ii) all Permits required to restore the Building and shall proceed with due diligence to complete the restoration of the Building.  
L237: Excused Performance.  Without limitation of Section 10.1 in the event and for so long as Lessee is hindered delayed or prevented from constructing or operating the Solar Facility in whole or part or in performing any of its obligations hereunder by reason of unusually severe natural or climatic occurrences strikes lockouts unavailability of materials or equipment unavailability of utilities services governmental action (including a Change in Law) or inaction casualty riots insurrections war epidemics or the acts or omissions of Lessor or other similar events or conditions in all such events which Lessee could not have avoided and to the extent such event could not be mitigated by the exercise of reasonable diligence then performance of Lessee’s obligations to the extent affected by such event or condition shall be excused for the applicable period including the payment of Rent which shall be proportionally abated to the extent the Solar Facility is unable to generate or deliver electricity during such period.  The then-effective Term (and the underlying Construction Period or Operation Period then in effect) shall be extended as requested by Lessee up to a period equivalent to the period during which the Solar Facility was unable to fully operate.  
L238: CONDEMNATION
L239: Taking.  If either Party receives notice of any proceedings for the taking or condemnation of all or a portion of the Building  or Property or any circumstance that could result in the material impairment of Insolation at the Site (a “Taking”) the Party receiving such notice shall promptly give notice to the other Party and such other Party may also appear in such proceeding.  In the event of a permanent Taking Lessee may determine in its sole discretion that the continued use and occupancy of the remainder of the Site and Easements cannot reasonably be made to be safe economically viable structurally sound and otherwise feasible for the Permitted Use and in such case may terminate this Lease unless modifications can be made to the Site or Easements to provide for the Permitted Use.  In the event of a Taking each Party shall be entitled to receive and retain such separate awards and portions of lump sum awards as may be allocated to their respective interests in any condemnation proceedings.  If the condemning authority does not make separate awards the award will be allocated on a proportionate value basis.  If the Parties are unable to agree as to such proportion then each Party shall select a recognized and neutral independent appraiser experienced in the appraisal of real estate and solar power facilities who shall determine the allocation.  The cost of the appraiser shall be borne equally by the Parties.  Nothing herein shall limit the rights of either Party to participate in such condemnation proceedings or seek specific compensation from a condemning authority.
L240: INSURANCE
L241: Insurance.  At all times during the Term hereof the Parties shall maintain the insurance policies and coverages as set forth in Schedule 3.
L242: FINANCING PARTY PROTECTIONS; lessor mortgages
L243: Collateral Assignment.
L244: Lessee may collaterally assign pledge mortgage or grant a security interest to and/or otherwise encumber in favor of any Financing Party as security for any financing of the Solar Facility all of Lessee’s right title and interest in (i) this Lease (ii) the Site (iii) the Easements (iv) the Solar Facility and (v) any other property owned by Lessee and located at the Building all without the consent of Lessor.  Lessee may obtain at its sole expense a survey or title insurance policy insuring its leasehold interest in and to the Site and its easement interest in the Easements.
L245: Any Financing Party may (i) enforce its rights under its leasehold mortgage or other loan and security documents that encumber or otherwise convey a security or other interests in and to the property and assets of Lessee including Lessee’s leasehold interest in the Site and easement interest in the Easements and its rights title and interests in and to this Lease the Solar Facility and all other improvements equipment and other personal property of Lessee located at the Site and within the Easements (ii) acquire title to Lessee’s interest in the Site and the Easements under this Lease in any lawful way (iii) pending foreclosure of such interests take possession to the extent of Lessee’s interest therein in the Site and the Easements and (iv) obtain at such Financing Party’s or Lessee’s sole expense a title insurance policy insuring such interests in favor of the Financing Party.  If a Financing Party acquires title to Lessee’s interest in this Lease by lawful means including by foreclosure then the Financing Party may assign this Lease to its designee.
L246: Estoppel Certificates.  
L247: Lessor shall from time to time within ten (10) days after receipt of Lessee’s written request therefor deliver to Lessee a written statement addressed to Lessee and/or to any Financing Party (as specified by Lessee) (each an “Estoppel Certificate”) certifying such matters as the following: (i) that the Lease is unmodified and in full force and effect (or if modified a brief description of such modification and that this Lease as so modified is in full force and effect); (ii) that the Lease attached to the Estoppel Certificate is a true and correct copy of this Lease as then in effect; (iii) that to the knowledge of Lessor Lessee has not previously assigned or encumbered its rights or interests in this Lease except as described in such Estoppel Certificate; (iv) the term of this Lease and the Rent then in effect; (v) the date through which Lessee has paid Rent; (vi) that to Lessor’s knowledge Lessee is not in breach of this Lease and no Event of Default is continuing hereunder (or if applicable a description of such breach or Event of Default); and (vii) such other matters as are reasonably requested by the Financing Party.
L248: Without limitation of Lessee’s rights and remedies arising out of Lessor’s failure to timely provide an Estoppel Certificate such failure by Lessor to deliver an Estoppel Certificate shall be conclusive evidence that (i) this Lease is in full force and effect without modification except as may be represented by Lessee and (ii) that there are no uncured defaults by Lessee or Lessor hereunder.
L249: Subordination and Non-Disturbance.
L250: In the event that Lessor grants any mortgage deed of trust or other security instrument (collectively the “Mortgages” individually a “Mortgage”) that encumber some or all of the Building the Site or the Easements to certain Persons (each such Person a “Mortgagee”).
L251: For each Mortgage that is in effect or of record on or prior to the effective recordation in the applicable land records of memorandums with regard to this Lease and the Easements Lessor will obtain from the Mortgagee within thirty (30) days of Lessee’s request a reasonable and customary subordination and non-disturbance among Lessor such Mortgagee and Lessee pursuant to which (i) Lessee confirms that this Lease is subordinated to the Mortgage granted to such Mortgagee and the Lessee will attorn to such Mortgagee in the event that the Mortgagee acquires title to the Building and (ii) such Mortgagee shall honor this Lease that the Lease shall remain in full force and effect and shall not be terminated and Lessee shall be permitted to exercise all of its rights and remedies hereunder including in the event of foreclosure under the Mortgage to which such Mortgagee is a party.
L252: EVENTS OF DEFAULT
L253: Events of Default.  The following events affecting the applicable Party shall each constitute an “Event of Default” as to such Party.
L254: The Party fails to perform or comply in any material respect with any agreement of such Party in this Lease (other than those specified in clauses (b) (c) and (d) of this Section 14.1) and such failure continues for thirty (30) days after receipt of written notice thereof from the non-defaulting Party; provided that if the defaulting Party commences commercially reasonable actions to cure such failure but cannot reasonably effect such cure within the thirty (30) day period and the breach has not and is not reasonably likely during such period to have or to exacerbate a material adverse effect on the other Party the period to cure such breach shall be extended by an additional sixty (60) days.
L255: Any representation or warranty made in this Lease is inaccurate in any material respect and the adverse effects or potential adverse effects of such inaccuracy is not resolved within thirty (30) days of notice from the other Party. 
L256: Subject in the case of Lessee to the rights of any Financing Party The Party (i) is dissolved (other than pursuant to a consolidation amalgamation or merger) (ii) becomes insolvent or is unable to pay its debts or fails (or admits in writing its inability) generally to pay its debts as they become due (iii) makes a general assignment arrangement or composition with or for the benefit of its creditors (iv) has instituted against it a proceeding seeking a judgment of insolvency or bankruptcy or any other relief under any bankruptcy or insolvency law or other similar law affecting creditor’s rights or a petition is presented for its winding-up reorganization or liquidation which proceeding or petition is not dismissed stayed or vacated within forty-five (45) Business Days thereafter (v) commences a voluntary proceeding seeking a judgment of insolvency or bankruptcy or any other relief under any bankruptcy or insolvency law or other similar law affecting creditors’ rights (vi) seeks or consents to the appointment of an administrator provisional liquidator conservator receiver trustee custodian or other similar official for it or for all or substantially all of its assets (vii) has a secured party take possession of all or substantially all of its assets or has a distress execution attachment sequestration or other legal process levied enforced or sued on or against all or substantially all of its assets (viii) causes or is subject to any event which under the applicable laws of any jurisdiction has an analogous effect to any of the events specified in clauses (i) through (vii) inclusive; or (A) takes any action in furtherance of or indicating its consent to approval of or acquiescence in any of the foregoing acts.
L257: The Party assigns this Lease in whole or in part in violation of Section 17.
L258: Termination for Default; Remedies.  
L259:  For so long as an Event of Default is continuing the non-defaulting Party may give written notice to the defaulting Party identifying such Event of Default and stating that this Lease shall terminate on the date specified in such notice and this Lease shall terminate on the date specified in such notice except that at any time when any portion of the Solar Facility is located on that Site or the Easements Lessor shall not commence any action or proceeding to terminate cancel rescind or reform this Lease and Lessor may exercise its remedies to seek damages in respect of Lessee’s breach as provided herein; provided that subject to the cure periods herein if Lessee fails to pay rent due to Lessor or any unappealable damages awarded to Lessor then Lessor may terminate this Lease by giving written notice to Lessee.
L260:  Subject to the limitations in this Lease including as provided in Section 14.2(a) each Party may exercise all rights and remedies available at law or in equity with respect to a breach of this Lease whether or not an Event of Default has occurred or is continuing.  Each Party shall have a duty to mitigate damages that it may incur as a result of the other Party’s breach of this Lease.
L261: INDEMNIFICATION
L262: Lessor’s Indemnity.  To the fullest extent permitted by Law Lessor shall defend indemnify and hold harmless Lessee and its officers directors employees contractors agents Affiliates representatives and Financing Party (“Lessee Indemnitees”) from and against any and all liabilities including losses expenses damages fines penalties court costs and reasonable attorneys’ fees (collectively “Damages”) arising or resulting from the claims demands suits or causes of action of third parties (collectively “Claims”) arising out of or in connection with personal injury or property damage attributable to the negligence or willful misconduct of Lessor or any Lessor Indemnitee or other Person directly or indirectly employed or engaged by Lessor; provided that Lessee Indemnitees shall not be entitled to make a claim under this Section 15.1 to the extent the applicable Claim is attributable to the gross negligence or willful misconduct of any Lessee Indemnitee.  For purposes of this Section 15.1 Lessor Indemnitees and any other Person directly or indirectly employed or engaged by Lessor shall be third parties.
L263: Lessee’s Indemnity.  To the fullest extent permitted by Law Lessee shall defend indemnify and hold harmless Lessor and its officers directors employees contractors agents Affiliates and representatives (“Lessor Indemnitees”) from and against any and all Damages resulting from Claims arising out of personal injury or property damage incurred by third parties and any and all fines or penalties imposed by any Governmental Authority arising out of or in connection with personal injury or property damage attributable to the negligence or willful misconduct of Lessee or any Lessee Indemnitee or other Person directly or indirectly employed or engaged by Lessee; provided Lessor Indemnitees shall not be entitled to make a claim under this Section 15.2 to the extent that the applicable Claim is attributable to the gross negligence or willful misconduct of any Lessor Indemnitee.  For purposes of this Section 15.2 Lessee Indemnitees and any other Person directly or indirectly employed or engaged by Lessee shall be third parties.
L264: Environmental Indemnification.
L265: Lessee shall indemnify defend and hold harmless Lessor’s Indemnified Parties from and against all Liabilities arising out of or relating to the existence at on above below or in the vicinity of the Property of any Hazardous Material to the extent Lessee or any of its contractors has brought such Hazardous Material to the Property and used stored deposited spilled or released such Hazardous Materials in violation of Environmental Law.
L266: Lessor shall indemnify defend and hold harmless lessee’s Indemnified Parties from and against all Liabilities arising out of or relating to the use or existence at on above below or in the vicinity of the Property of any Hazardous Material (except to the extent Lessee or its contractors brought such Hazardous Material to the Property and used stored deposited spilled or released such Hazardous Material in violation of Environmental Law).
L267: Notice.  Each Party shall promptly notify the other Party of any Claim or threatened claim demand or proceeding in respect of which it is or may be entitled to indemnification under this Section 15.  Such notice shall be given as soon as reasonably practicable after the relevant Party becomes aware of the Claims or threatened claim demand or proceeding.
L268: Defense of Claims.
L269: The Indemnifying Party shall be entitled to assume and control the defense of such claim action suit or proceeding at its expense with counsel of its selection provided (i) it gives prompt notice of its intention to do so to the Indemnitee and reimburses the Indemnitee(s) for the reasonable costs and expenses incurred by the Indemnitee prior to the assumption by the Indemnifying Party of such defense and (ii) such counsel is reasonably acceptable to the Indemnitee.
L270: Unless and until the Indemnifying Party acknowledges in writing its obligation to indemnify the Indemnitee and assumes control of the defense of a claim suit action or proceeding in accordance with this Section 15.5 the Indemnitee shall have the right but not the obligation to contest defend and litigate with counsel of its own selection any claim action suit or proceeding by any third party alleged or asserted against the Indemnitee in respect of resulting from related to or arising out of any matter for which it is entitled to be indemnified hereunder and the reasonable costs thereof shall be subject to the obligations of the Indemnifying Party under this Section 15.
L271: Following the acknowledgement of the indemnification and the assumption of the defense by the Indemnifying Party the Indemnitee shall have the right to employ its own counsel and such counsel may participate in such claim suit action or preceding but the fees and expenses of such counsel shall be at the expense of such Indemnitee when and as incurred unless (i) the employment of counsel by such Indemnitee has been authorized in writing by the Indemnifying Party (ii) the Indemnitee shall have reasonably concluded that there may be a conflict of interest between the Indemnifying Party and the Indemnitee in the conduct of the defense of such action (iii) the Indemnitee shall have reasonably concluded that counsel selected by the Indemnifying Party is not acceptable or (iv) the Indemnitee shall have reasonably concluded and specifically notified the Indemnifying Party either that there may be specific defenses available to it that are different from or additional to those available to the Indemnifying Party or that such claim action suit or proceeding involves or could have a material adverse effect on the Indemnitee beyond the scope of this Lease.
L272: 
L273: LIMITATIONS OF LIABILITY
L274: Limitations of Liability.  EXCEPT AS AND TO THE EXTENT SPECIFICALLY PROVIDED FOR HEREIN  NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY SPECIAL PUNITIVE EXEMPLARY INDIRECT INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS LEASE.  FOR THE AVOIDANCE OF DOUBT ACTUAL DAMAGES COMPENSATORY DAMAGES AND DIRECT DAMAGES SHALL NOT CONSTITUTE CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES FOR PURPOSES OF THIS LEASE.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANYTHING HEREIN IN NO EVENT SHALL LESSEE’S CUMULATIVE LIABILITY HEREUNDER EXCEED AN AMOUNT EQUAL TO [________] OF RENT PAYABLE BY LESSEE HEREUNDER EXCEPT (i) IN THE CASE OF FRAUD OR GROSS NEGLIGENCE AND (ii) EXCLUDING THE AMOUNT OF ANY INSURANCE PROCEEDS RECEIVED IN CONNECTION WITH ANY CLAIM INDEMNIFIED BY LESSEE UNDER SECTION 15 UP TO THE REQUIRED COVERAGE AMOUNTS FOR THE APPLICABLE INSURANCE COVERAGE REQUIRED PURSUANT TO SECTION 12.  
L275: Assignment
L276: Assignment by Lessee.  Lessee may assign or transfer this Lease or its rights under this Lease in whole or in part without the consent of Lessor provided that the assignee assumes in writing all of Lessee’s obligations hereunder.  Following such assignment Lessee shall have no further liability hereunder.  
L277: Assignment by Lessor.  Lessor shall assign its rights and obligations under this Lease to any successor in interest in and to the fee title in the Site.  Any assignment of this Lease by Lessor other than in connection with the conveyance of fee title to the Site shall be subject to the consent of the Lessee in its sole discretion.  Lessor warrants that any sale conveyance transfer or other disposition of the Building or the Easements or any part thereof or interest therein or this Lease or any part thereof or interest herein to any Person by transfer of fee title to the Building or a part thereof by the granting of leasehold interest in and to or an easement over the Building or any part thereof or by any encumbrance of the Building or any part thereof by assignment or other disposition of this Lease or any part hereof or any right or interest herein or otherwise the Property and the Easements shall remain subject to this Lease and the terms and provisions hereof and Lessee’s rights title interests and remedies hereunder for the Term of this Lease.
L278: MISCELLANEOUS  
L279: Publicity.  Neither Party shall use any name trade name service mark or trademark of the other Party in any promotional or advertising material without the prior written consent of the other Party.  Neither Party shall make any press release or public announcement regarding this Lease (except for filings or other statements as may be required by Applicable Law) without the specific prior written consent of the other Party.
L280: Third Party Beneficiaries.  Other than as provided in Section 15 this Lease and each and every provision hereof is for the exclusive benefit of the Parties their successors and permitted assigns and not for the benefit of any other Person.
L281: Amendments and Modifications.  This Lease may be supplemented or amended only by mutual agreement of the Parties made in writing.
L282: Survival.  Notwithstanding any provisions herein to the contrary any provisions necessary to give effect to the intent of the Parties hereunder after

content.text: Removal.  Within one hundred eighty (180) days after the expiration of the Term or earlier termination of this Lease as provided herein Lessee at its sole cost and expense shall decommission and remove the Solar Facility installed as provided in Section 2.2(c) from the Site and to the extent applicable the Easements.  Lessee shall remove any remaining debris and equipment from the Site and the Property following the removal.  If Lessee does not remove or commence and continue efforts to remove the Solar Facility within such one hundred eighty (180) day period then the Solar Facility shall be deemed abandoned by Lessee. The Lessor shall give Lessee written notice of abandonment and state that Lessee’s rights under this Lease shall expire and terminate on the date specified in such notice which shall be no earlier than an additional thirty (30) days following such notice and on and following the date specified at Lessor’s sole discretion (i) Lessor shall have the right to assume title to the Solar Facility and Lessee shall thereupon have no further liability in respect thereof or (ii) within a further ninety (90) days Lessor may remove the Solar Facility or other improvements at Lessee’s cost and in a commercially reasonable manner in accordance with Applicable Law.  For the avoidance of doubt and if applicable Lessee shall have no obligation to (w) restore the Site or the Easements to their contours prior to construction of the Solar Facility (x) remove (A) supports anchors penetrations conduits or other similar ancillary equipment if in Lessee’s reasonable determination such removal could cause harm or damage to the Site the Building or the Easements or (B) any below-grade foundations or underground buried or covered conduits and cabling installed by Lessee at the Site (including equipment installed on or in the Building) or at the Easements all of which shall be decommissioned in accordance with Applicable Law and abandoned in place (y) restore any improvements removed or modified in connection with the Permitted Use or (z) replant any vegetation removed in connection with the Permitted Use.

parts: According to the Solar Site Lease Agreement, the responsibility for the removal of the solar panels falls on the lessee. Specifically, within 180 days after the expiration of the lease term or earlier termination of the lease, the lessee is required to decommission and remove the solar facility at their own cost and expense. This includes removing any remaining debris and equipment from the site and the property following the removal. If the lessee fails to commence or continue efforts to remove the solar facility within the specified period, the solar facility is deemed abandoned. In this case, the lessor has the right to either assume title to the solar facility or remove it at the lessee's expense【9†source】.
what about in the case of roof leaks

In the case of roof leaks, the Solar Site Lease Agreement specifies that the lessee is responsible for removing the solar panels if necessary to repair roof leaks. The lessee must do so in a manner that prevents further damage to the roof. Additionally, the lessee is required to repair any damage to the roof caused by the installation, operation, maintenance, removal, or presence of the solar facility, at their own expense. This includes leaks or other impairments to the roof's integrity.

In the case of roof leaks, the Solar Site Lease Agreement states that the lessee is responsible for the removal of the solar panels, if necessary, to repair such leaks. The lessee must conduct the removal in a manner that prevents further damage to the roof. Additionally, the lessee is obliged to repair at its own expense any damage to the roof caused by the installation, operation, maintenance, removal, or presence of the solar facility, including damage manifesting as leaks or other impairments to the integrity of the roof【9†source】.
how long is the due diligence period.  Can lessor cancel agreement if that time period is exceeded?

The due diligence period in the Solar Site Lease Agreement is specified as ninety (90) days from the Effective Date of the Agreement. Regarding the lessor's ability to cancel the agreement if this time period is exceeded, the document does not provide explicit information on this matter in the sections accessible to me. For a definitive answer, it would be necessary to review the entire agreement or consult with a legal expert who can interpret the specific terms and conditions outlined in the document【9†source】.
can the lessee terminate the lease

According to the Solar Site Lease Agreement, the lessee has the right to terminate the lease. The lessee may terminate the lease at any time during the Term by providing the lessor with ninety (90) days prior written notice. However, upon such termination by the lessee, they are required to decommission and remove the solar facility, as well as perform other obligations related to the termination of the lease, as detailed in the agreement【9†source】.
